Administration.text:
Type: Pediculicide
Dosage Forms:
Routes of Administration: topical
Common Trade Names:

Adult_Dosing.text:
Second line therapy only for patients who have failed other agents
Scabies: apply thin layer and massage on entire body except face, remove after 8-12h
Head lice: apply 1-2 oz of shampoo on dry hair, leave on for 4min, lather/rinse and remove nits with fine comb

Pediatric_Dosing.text:
Second line therapy only for patients who have failed other agents
Caution if patient weighs <50kg
Scabies: apply thin layer and massage on entire body except face, remove after 8-12h
Head lice: apply 1-2 oz of shampoo on dry hair, leave on for 4min, lather/rinse and remove nits with fine comb

Lactation_risk.text: Do not breastfeed for 24h after application

Contraindications.text:
Allergy to class/drug
Premature neonates (<28 do) (increased absorption)
Uncontrolled seizure disorder
Norwegian (crusted) scabies
Skin conditions that may increase systemic absorption (weeping surface, inflamed skin etc)
Caution with:
HIV infection
Prior seizure
Prior head trauma
CNS tumor
Severe hepatic cirrhosis
Excess alcohol use or abrupt withdrawal from alcohol or benzos
Concomitant use of meds that lower seizure threshold
Weight <50kg

Serious.text:
Neurotoxicity (seizures), ataxia
Arrhythmia
Pulmonary edema
Aplastic anemia

Common.text:
Skin irritation, contact dermatitis, alopecia, urticaria
Dizziness
Restlessness
Hematuria
Paresthesia
Nausea/vomiting

Pharmacology.text:
Half-life: 17-22h
Metabolism: liver
Excretion: urine and feces

Mechanism_of_Action.text:
"Following absorption through the chitinous exoskeleton of arthropods, cyclic chlorinated hydrocarbons like lindane presumably stimulate the nervous system, resulting in seizures & death of parasite"
[1]

Comments.text: Black box for neurotoxicity, banned in several countries and California due to neurotoxicity
